CatDescriptText: Cutline of related images published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 29, 1961, pg. 24, reads: "Nine Negroes Among 22 Steeler Hopefuls - "Here, on the campus of Slippery Rock State Teachers College, Tuesday morning, the eager but cold eyes of Coach Buddy Parker were weighing the muscular symphony of 22 individual 1961 Pittsburgh Steelers' rookies, nine of whom were young men of color..."Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 29, 1961, pg. A26, reads: "Buddy and 'Buddy' - Coach Buddy Parker, famed mentor of the Pittsburgh Steelers of the National Football League, takes a minute to relax with one of his favorite people, Wallace (Boots) Lewis, general purposes man for the team. Mr. Lewis is the most popular figure at the Slippery Rock, Pa., training camp of the Steelers. - Harris Photo.?
TitMainTitle: Pittsburgh Steelers football team coach "Buddy" Parker, posed with hand on shoulder of trainer Wallace "Boots" Lewis, on athletic field at Slippery Rock State Teachers College
CatSubject_tab: Men--Pennsylvania--Slippery Rock.Pittsburgh Steelers (Football team).Slippery Rock State Teachers College.
